title: Shocking elimination on ‘Dancing With the Stars’ leads to tears and frustration
text:
Everyone in the ballroom of Dancing With the Stars was in shock Monday night, after Sailor Brinkley-Cook was eliminated from the competition. Sailor replaced her mother Christie Brinkley at the start of the season after she broke her wrist and arm in rehearsal.

Sailor has had an up and down season but was considered to be one of the better dancers coming into the week. In fact, Monday’s jive earned her three 9’s from the judges, for a total score of 27. That was tied for top score of the evening, while Sean Spicer’s score of 21 was at the very bottom.

Tom Bergeron said, “This has been a complete shock.” And judge Carrie Ann Inaba echoed his sentiments saying, “I’m shocked.”

Fans at home were also shocked and took to Twitter to voice their disapproval.

Sailor and Val didn’t deserve to be eliminated 😡😭 #dwts pic.twitter.com/rddYOqxcOk — Marie ❄️🔥 (@dwtsvalentin) October 22, 2019

Really #DWTS I cannot believe Sailor is gone and Sean is safe. Absolutely ridiculous!!!!! 🤬🤬🤬 — Bobbi Rosensteel (@mich_kygirl) October 22, 2019

This wouldn’t happen if the judges stopped giving 7s for effort .... #dwts — Claire Charness (@clairecharness) October 22, 2019

Eliminations like these seem to occur every season because the show isn’t just about dancing, it’s also about being America’s favorite dancer. And while the truth may hurt some, Sean is a much more popular dancer.

While Sailor appeared to be inconsolable after the elimination, she should be proud of all the effort she put into the season.

Dancing With the Stars airs Mondays at 8 p.m. on ABC.

description: Despite receiving all 9's for Monday's performance, Sailor Brinkley-Cook was sent home.
